item.title: cargo-wix
item.description: cargo-wix is a tool to create windows installers. if there are multiple .exe files where main.exe depends on the others, a bundle can be created.

item.title: creating a mac installer
item.description: install builder uses click install app to build the installer but it’s too expensive dcp setup maker could another solution.

item.title: helix editor
item.description: I saw the zee “terminal” text editor but it was mainly inspired by emacs… not for me. Played around with it but I can’t live without my vim bindings.

item.title: lazygit
item.description: github nice git terminal UI installing in ubuntu: 1 2 3 sudo add-apt-repository ppa:lazygit-team/daily sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install lazygit

item.title: meilisearch
item.description: website a search engine built with rust

item.title: nvm
item.description: nvm node version manager. helpful when working with projects that use specific node versions.

item.title: outline css debugging
item.description: quick way to add outlines for all html elements to check for overflows for example. ![[attachments/Pasted image 20230504190419.png]] use the plus icon to add a new css rule with the * selector:

item.title: skim_rs
item.description: skim - like fzf but written in rust! https://williamhuey.github.io/posts/rust-fzf-alternative-skim/ i don’t understand how to used it properly within vim yet

item.title: trunk
item.description: https://trunk.io/ Trunk simplifies checking, testing, and merging your code, allowing you to focus on writing features instead of babysitting PRs.

item.title: vim-copy-paste
item.description: Copying from vim to system clipboard is very useful. It can be tricky though. I only started using it recently, in reference to today’s date: 2022-04-04.
